review: Small, plugged in and started right up. It does not have many buttons or options. I like the simplicity. Use it for Sling TV. Mostly works good.
author: Arthur Soule

review: Great device, and super easy to use. I had another "stick" before, but returned it within days of receiving the Fire Stick. Then bought a second Fire Stick for my other TV.The other "stick" could only stream using another device in the house. This meant always having my phone in my hand, or running back and forth between my TV and my PC. The Fire Stick does all the streaming for you, and you can add more apps to stream other content or play games. The Fire Stick also comes with a remote which the other "stick" does not have.The other "stick" would constantly lose connection to my wireless network. The router is only 15 feet from my TV! The Fire Stick has never lost connection. Even the one all the way across the house doesn't lose connection.Anyone loking to buy an inexpensive streaming device for their TV should spend the extra $5 and get the Fire Stick. It is well worth it.

review: I also have an AppleTV, but I had to give this a try since it was so cheap. I really like it since I can install a  lot of the apps from the app store, which you cannot do with the AppleTV. The only gripe I have is that this device stutters from time to time when I am streaming Netflix in HD. I think the processor may be a bit under powered, but for the $20 it cost, I am not complaining.

review: I just purchased a second Fire TV Stick for use with my bedroom TV.  I think that says it all.  Inexpensive, easy to install and use.  Unit does not need to be in direct line of sight with the remote control, so can be inconspicuous.  Very nice and an excellent value.
